history.narrative: Law 10-129, the “Human Rights Amendment Act 1994,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 10-298, which was referred to the Committee on Public Services and Youth Affairs. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on March 1, 1994, and April 12, 1994, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on April 28, 1994, it was assigned Act No. 10-228 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 10-129 became effective on June 28, 1994.
